titleStmt.title: John W. Finnell to Nathaniel Gaither, Jr.
CWG8299

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Beriah Magoffin: Governor's Official Correspondence File, Military Appointments, 1859-1862

body.p:
UNITED WE STAND, DIVIDED WE FALL.
KENTUCKY.
Head-Quarters Kentucky Volunteer Militia,
ADJUTANT GENERAL'S OFFICE,
Frankfort, 13 Feb 1862.

Hon: Nat Gaither Jr
Sec: of State-

The Commissions of Harvey M. Buckley Colo & Wm W. Berry Lt Colo have been changed as to date- dated 1 Jan 1862 & changed to 5 October 1861_ & the balance of the officers of Colo Buckley's Regiment have had the dates of their Commissions changed from the 1st January 1862 to the 9th of September 1861_ viz: Henry C Dunlap ^Adjt^ John Matthews Surgeon_ Tho. S. Swain Asst Surgeon- Tho. C. Pomroy Qr Master- James H. Bristow Chaplain_ Captains as follows; John D Brent_ Wm Mangan_ August Schweitzer- Asaph H. Speed- John M. Huston_ John L. Treanor- Lafayette P. Lovett_ Alexander B. Furgeson_ John E. Vansant & Charles L. Thomasson_ 1st Lieutenant as follows: Geo. W. Richardson_ John M. Smith- Stephen Lindenfelsen- Richard Jones- David Q. Reasseau- William W. Roland_ John P. Hunley- Upton Wilson_ John Lucas-
Norman B. Moninger- and 2d Lieutenants, as follows- George Wyatt- Thomas Foreman- Frank Dissell- Christopher Leonard- Theodore E. Elliott- Theodore F. Cummins- Thomas I. McManen- Wilson I. Green- John Martz- & Edward W. Johnston-
I send this that you may make the necessary changes-

Very Resply
John W. Finnell
Adjt Genl
